main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
content:
# Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact  
![Headshot of article author Alex Powers](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/e10befad41bc82e58e06ab24bb7b0978e636c33c81695cbf4714edb1da689f83?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Alex Powers](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/alpowers/ "Posts by Alex Powers")**  
December 16, 2025  
2025 was a monumental year for Microsoft Power BI, marked by its 10-year anniversary and a series of community celebrations, global contests, and product advancements that delivered new capabilities empowering users to turn data into action faster than ever. Below we recap some of the year’s biggest highlights—from milestone events to feature breakthroughs—that made 2025 a year to remember.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Celebrating 10 years of Power BI
content:
## Celebrating 10 years of Power BI  
July 2025 marked Power BI’s 10-year anniversary, a milestone celebrated with the community through special events, contests, and learning opportunities. When Power BI was launched a decade ago, it had about 500,000 early adopters: today it’s used by over 375,000 organizations worldwide. In fact, 30 million monthly active users now rely on Power BI for insights—a testament to how the community of users have transformed business intelligence at scale and how far the platform has come as creators now leverage the full power of Microsoft Fabric empowering users with a unified experience for data and AI driven innovation.  
To celebrate this achievement, Power BI rolled out the [“#PBI10” anniversary events](https://aka.ms/pbi10). A two-month learning bonanza ([live expert-led skill sessions](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mRdX0jYoHJk), dashboard design workshops, and AMA Q&As), discounted certification exam vouchers, and even a fun retrospective startup experience in Power BI Desktop that paid homage to the product’s evolution. The festivities culminated in a [virtual birthday party](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbpEawj9I_Q), featuring the Power BI team, who shared behind-the-scenes stories, highlighted the platform’s journey, and gave a sneak peek of the future in an interactive live stream. Throughout the celebration, longtime users and newcomers alike were invited to share their own Power BI stories and creative dashboards on social media using #PBI10, bringing to life a decade of impactful data culture.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Power BI Data Viz championships
content:
## Power BI Data Viz championships  
Another hallmark of 2025 was the launch of the Power BI Data Visualization World Championships, an unprecedented global contest that showcased the art of data storytelling by the Power BI community. The competition debuted at the Microsoft Fabric Community Conference (FabCon) in Las Vegas with a live showdown in front of a panel of judges and a large in person audience of attendees cheering on finalists. Contestants had 20 minutes to build a compelling report from scratch and in the thrilling finale, Jon Sandmann emerged as the inaugural Power BI DataViz World Champion, wowing judges with a report on [OECD well-being data](https://community.fabric.microsoft.com/t5/Contests-Gallery/Winning-Report-World-Champion-OECD-Global-Well-being/td-p/4643676) built in the allotted time.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/word-image-31939-1-2.png)  
The excitement continued into late summer at the Fabric Community Conference (FabCon Europe) in Vienna, Austria where another live championship face-off occurred that included outstanding contenders from around the globe. After an intense on-stage competition, Paulo Grijó of Brazil was announced as the Power BI DataViz World Champion. Paulo’s winning report incorporated a [color vision deficiency simulator](https://community.fabric.microsoft.com/t5/Contests-Gallery/World-Champion-Winner-Live-Finale-Build-Europe-s-Flavor-Story/td-p/4840315) to emphasize inclusive design, and his innovative approach truly impressed the audience and judges. His victory at FabCon EU, alongside Jon’s win in the US, exemplified the global nature of Power BI’s community—with top talent spanning continents.  
![No alternative text description for this image](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/no-alternative-text-description-for-this-image-2.jpeg)  
The Power BI DataViz Championships not only crowned winners but also celebrated the amazing talents and diversity of the community with hundreds of participants taking part in the weekly design challenges, showcasing participants’ creativity, analytical storytelling, and technical skills and learning from each other. Microsoft provided not just prizes (like free FabCon conference passes and swag) but recognition with all finalist entries located in the [Power BI Community Gallery](https://community.fabric.microsoft.com/t5/Contests-Gallery/bd-p/pbi_contestsgallery/page/2?featured=yes&filter=dataviz+world+championship) to explore and get inspired before the next Power BI DataViz Championship event.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Breakthrough advancements
content:
## Breakthrough advancements  
Alongside community highlights, 2025 witnessed major product innovations in Power BI – many of which had been eagerly anticipated by users. These new features focused on making Power BI more open, actionable, and intelligent than ever. The following details some of the year’s most anticipated updates.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Desktop and web data modeling parity
content:
## Desktop and web data modeling parity  
The ability to [create and edit Power BI semantic models directly in the Power BI service (Generally Available)](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/service-edit-data-models) established core data modeling parity between Power BI Desktop and Power BI service, empowering more users including those operating on MacOS—the ability to develop their end-to-end solutions entirely through a web browser. This enables creators to handle the full workflow, from data ingestion and transformation with Power Query to modeling and report generation, without needing to transition development between the desktop and cloud. Additionally, all changes are automatically saved and supported by [semantic model version history](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/service-semantic-model-version-history) within the service.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/word-image-31939-3-2-scaled.png)

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Write Back Within Reports
content:
## Write Back Within Reports  
The introduction of translytical task flows (Preview) in Power BI allows users to trigger actions and write data back to source systems directly from a report, turning insights into action without leaving the experience. “Translytical” reflects the blending of transactional and analytical work; in practice, it means Power BI can now support write‑back and operational workflows that historically required separate applications. When a metric signals that something needs attention, the user can follow up immediately—modifying a record, adding context, or kicking off a custom workflow–without switching tools or breaking focus.  
This evolution is powered by [Fabric user data functions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/user-data-functions-overview), which enable reports to initiate actions that once lived entirely outside the business intelligence layer. It represents a shift toward more interactive, closed‑loop decision‑making, where a report becomes not just a place to observe what’s happening but a space where work can continue. At FabCon Vienna 2025, [Patrick LeBlanc illustrated this direction](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IryMPbSsv10&t=3313s) through a custom AI integration that generated text summaries based on user inputs using translytical task flows, demonstrating how these capabilities can support richer and more responsive report experiences.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/word-image-31939-4-2.png)

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: AI and Copilot: Chat with your data
content:
## AI and Copilot: Chat with your data  
Power BI embraced the AI revolution with the announcement of the [Chat with your data](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-chat-with-data-standalone) (Preview) experience, introduced at Microsoft Build 2025. This full‑screen chat interface lets users ask questions about their data in natural language queries like “What were this quarter’s sales by region?” to receive instant answers drawn from the reports, datasets, and apps they already have access to, all while honoring existing security permissions. Copilot identifies the most relevant sources, returns a clear response, and includes references back to the visuals or models that informed its response, helping users understand exactly where each insight came from.  
Throughout the year, Copilot became even more accessible with the preview of [Copilot in Power BI Mobile](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-november-2025-feature-summary/#post-31766-_Toc214035073), bringing natural‑language data exploration to phones through voice or text. Improvements across the experience made answers more reliable and contextual, supported by clearer guidance and features like [verified answers](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-prepare-data-ai-verified-answers), which ensured certain responses came from vetted, authoritative definitions. These updates reflect a broader move toward conversational BI, where anyone can explore data simply by asking. As organizations lean further into AI‑assisted decision‑making, Chat with your data lowers the barrier to engaging with Power BI—making insights easier to reach, easier to understand, and closer to the way people naturally think.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Turning everyday documents into analytics ready data
content:
## Turning everyday documents into analytics ready data  
[OneDrive and SharePoint shortcuts in OneLake (Preview)](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/blog/turning-everyday-documents-from-sharepoint-and-onedrive-into-analytics-ready-data-with-onelake-shortcuts) (introduced at the Power Platform Community Conference 2025) make it easy for everyday users to bring familiar files—Word documents, Excel workbooks, PowerPoint decks, PDFs—directly alongside their analytics and operational data in [OneLake](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/onelake/onelake-overview), giving users a single place to find both business context and structured information without duplicating content.  
Because the files remain in their original locations, existing permissions stay intact, ensuring a secure and seamless experience. This avoids duplicated content and helps users stay confident they’re always working with the most up‑to‑date version. With Fabric treating these shortcut‑linked files like native OneLake content, insights automatically reflect any changes made to the documents, allowing users to spend less time gathering and copying information between platforms and more time understanding it.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/word-image-31939-5-2.png)

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: And more…
content:
## And more…  
While we highlighted only a handful of updates, we encourage you to subscribe to the Power BI blog feed—or use your preferred RSS reader—from the righthand menu of the Power BI Blog [home page](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/). It’s the easiest way to stay informed about what’s coming next, especially as we look toward 2026, and the many improvements that will continue to shape the product and excite our community, including enhancements like the [new visual defaults for Power BI reports](https://roadmap.fabric.microsoft.com/?product=powerbi) and visual improvements. These updates introduce richer customization options, refresh the base themes, and help anyone to create professional‑looking reports in seconds.

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Join us in Atlanta for FabCon + SQLCon 2026
content:
## Join us in Atlanta for FabCon + SQLCon 2026  
Mark your calendar for March 16–20, 2026, when [FabCon](https://aka.ms/fabcon) and [SQLCon](https://sqlcon.us/) come together in [Atlanta, Georgia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CtResi4PbU8) for an unforgettable week that unites the entire data community. From Power BI and Microsoft Fabric developers to SQL Server and Azure SQL professionals, this co‑located experience brings everyone under one roof to learn, connect, and explore the full power of Fabric, Power BI, SQL Server, Azure SQL, Real‑Time Intelligence, AI, data engineering, and analytics.  
With inspiring keynotes at State Farm Arena, deep‑dive workshops, more than 200 technical sessions, a buzzing expo hall, a vibrant community lounge, and the Power BI Data Viz World Championship at the Georgia World Congress Center, there’s truly something for every data professional. Even better, one registration grants full access to both FabCon and SQLCon— giving you the freedom to mix sessions, meet experts, and engage with peers across the entire Microsoft data ecosystem. With SQLCon now officially integrated, attendees will be immersed into the latest innovations across SQL Server and Azure SQL, including roadmap updates, performance tuning, security advancements, and AI‑powered applications.  
Whether you want to sharpen your skills, expand your career, or simply reignite your passion for data, FabCon + SQLCon 2026 is the place to be. We can’t wait to welcome you to Atlanta as we continue building the future of data together. [Register now](https://fabriccon.com/index.php/tickets) with code FABCOMM to get $200 off registration!  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/12/word-image-31939-6-2.png)

main_title: Power BI 2025 holiday recap: A decade of innovation and impact
title: Conclusion: 10 years of innovation setting the stage for the future
content:
## Conclusion: 10 years of innovation setting the stage for the future  
If 2025 served as an example, the groundwork is firmly established for Power BI’s next decade to be just as transformative as its first. Across FabCon, Microsoft Build, the Power Platform Community Conference, and countless conversations with our community, one theme stands out: wherever data lives—across Microsoft 365, the Power Platform, or Microsoft Fabric—Power BI is deeply integrated, helping users uncover insights that directly inform decisions. The community continues to be a driving force by [sharing ideas and voting](https://aka.ms/pbiideas), enabling feedback that drives our collective progress.  
Your feedback helps shapes the product—from advancing professional developer experiences like [TMDL](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/tmdl-view-generally-available) and [MCPs](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/power-bi-november-2025-feature-summary/#post-31766-_Toc214035083), to improving collaboration and content distribution through [Org apps](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/updates-to-org-apps-preview-more-customization-deployment-pipelines-and-git-plus-whats-next-like-new-license-support-and-audiences), to the ongoing enhancements in data visualization (yes, including tables and matrices!) with targeted release timelines provided by the [Fabric Roadmap](https://roadmap.fabric.microsoft.com/?product=powerbi).  
The Power BI team has outlined a future vision that prioritizes greater integration and seamless connection between insight and action, fostering innovation in data and insights through Microsoft Fabric and AI. The ongoing expansion of community initiatives in skilling, education, and events further supports this mission to ensure organizations can benefit from the latest product innovations.  
As 2025 concludes, the Power BI team extends sincere appreciation to the community, our customers, and partners, and looks forward to reconnecting in January 2026 with additional updates.  
Wishing everyone happy holidays and a happy new year!

main_title: Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models
title: Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models
content:
# Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models  
![Headshot of article author Kay Unkroth](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/b5b57054b0358727ef517293fa7221f3d8143d498c86a60df7feefbf7d98f2ea?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Kay Unkroth](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/kayu/ "Posts by Kay Unkroth")**
Principal Program Manager  
December 9, 2025  
The previous limitation preventing drillthrough (via Excel’s Show Details feature when using Analyze in Excel) on Direct Lake and DirectQuery semantic model has been removed.

main_title: Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models
title: What Changed
content:
## What Changed  
Historically, the Show Details feature in Excel relies on the MDX DRILLTHROUGH statement, which was only supported for Import models. Direct Lake and DirectQuery models returned an error or no rows.  
With recent updates, Power BI now supports drillthrough for Direct Lake and DirectQuery semantic models, enabling you to double‑click a PivotTable cell and retrieve the underlying detail rows—even when connected live to these types of models. Users can now enjoy a consistent drillthrough experience across Import, Direct Lake, and DirectQuery. You no longer need to switch to Import mode to support detailed analysis in Excel. And the drillthrough works seamlessly with existing RLS/OLS security configurations. Drillthrough respects all applied filters and security roles.

main_title: Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models
title: How to Use
content:
## How to Use  
Support for drillthrough is now available to Excel users out of the box. Just connect to your semantic model as always using Analyze in Excel. Ensure you’re using explicit measures or fields that support detail rows. Double‑click a leaf‑level cell in your PivotTable to view the underlying data.

main_title: Drillthrough in Excel now supported for Direct Lake and DirectQuery Models
title: Additional Notes
content:
## Additional Notes  
Keep in mind that drillthrough performance depends on the underlying source system and query complexity. This is especially important for semantic models in DirectQuery mode connecting to external data sources. For more details, refer to [Create Excel workbooks with refreshable Power BI data](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-analyze-in-excel).

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
content:
# Deprecating Power BI Q&A  
![Headshot of article author Monica Calleja Luque](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/c5da4cb969b9b611ec8c296a1f391d1ad3af48cc84ebe85f9b55b94da523fdc1?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Monica Calleja Luque](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/monicaclmicrosoft-com/ "Posts by Monica Calleja Luque")**  
December 1, 2025  
We are announcing the deprecation of Q&A, our legacy natural language tool, which will take place in **December 2026**. Moving forward, users can instead utilize Power BI Copilot, which provides a more advanced and integrated solution for querying your data with natural language.

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **Why this change?**
content:
## **Why this change?**  
Power BI Copilot now features an advanced natural language interface using generative AI, letting users ask questions, create visuals, and explore insights more accurately and more flexibly than with Q&A.  
By consolidating our natural language capabilities into Copilot, we’re able to:  
* Reduce confusion between overlapping features.
* Accelerate innovation and delivery of new and modern AI capabilities.
* Provide a more consistent and intuitive experience across Power BI.  
To support this transition, we are reviewing the approach for Pro licenses. Please stay
tuned for updates in the coming months.

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **What is affected by this deprecation?**
content:
## **What is affected by this deprecation?**  
1. **Q&A Experiences:** feature that allows users to interact with their data via natural language. Including:
* [Q&A in reports](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-q-and-a#use-qa-in-a-report) is available if the report author added a specific type of interactive visual called a Q&A visual or added a Q&A button.
* [Q&A on a dashboard](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-q-and-a#use-qa-on-a-dashboard) appears as a question box or button on the dashboard. Q&A is available at the top on dashboards in the Power BI service, and at the bottom of the dashboard in Power BI mobile ([Q&A virtual analyst in mobile app)](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/mobile/tutorial-mobile-apps-ios-qna).
* [Q&A in Power BI embedded analytics:](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embedded/qanda) developers integrate Q&A into custom apps through APIs or embedded tokens.
2. **Q&A Setup:** A suite of [tools](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/natural-language/q-and-a-tooling-intro) aimed at helping report authors improve the Q&A experience. This includes synonyms, linguistic relationships, row labels, hide from Q&A, teach Q&A, review questions, and suggest questions.

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **What is the deprecation timeline?**
content:
## **What is the deprecation timeline?**  
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| **Date** | **Action** |
| **December 2025** | Deprecation announcement. |
| **December 2026** | Q&A experiences and Q&A Setup will be fully retired from Power BI Desktop and Service.   · New creation of any Q&A experiences listed in this blog will no longer be permitted.   · Existing Q&A visuals in reports, dashboards, mobile, and embedded scenarios will no longer work or be available. |

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **If you are using Q&A experiences:**
content:
## **What should you do next?**  
### **If you are using Q&A experiences:**  
We recommend transitioning to [Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-introduction) and [Chat with your data](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-chat-with-data-standalone) experiences in Power BI. Here are the alternatives:  
* Q&A in reports – use [Copilot with Power BI reports](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-reports-overview).
* Q&A in Dashboards – use [Copilot standalone experience](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-chat-with-data-standalone).
* Q&A in Mobile – use [Copilot in Power BI Mobile](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/mobile/mobile-apps-copilot).
* Q&A Embedded – use [Copilot for SaaS scenarios](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/now-available-two-new-copilot-experiences/). For PaaS, copilot support will be arriving in the coming months.

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **If you are using Q&A Setup:**
content:
### **If you are using Q&A Setup:**  
Familiarize yourself with [Prep Data for AI](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-prepare-data-ai) and how it can replace Q&A Setup tooling.

main_title: Deprecating Power BI Q&A
title: **FAQ highlights**
content:
## **FAQ highlights**  
* **Will we still need to enable Q&A to use Copilot?**
+ No, Q&A and Copilot will be separated. We will introduce a new file format for Copilot to remove the current dependency. We’ll share more information about this soon.
* **What if I am using Q&A in Sovereign clouds?**
+ We are currently reviewing the timeline for Copilot in Sovereign clouds. Please stay tuned for further updates.
* **What if I am using Q&A with Power BI Pro license?**
+ To support this transition, we are reviewing the approach for Pro licenses. Please stay tuned for updates in the coming months.  
We are dedicated to ensuring that this transition goes smoothly. Migration documentation and additional information about the deprecation process will be provided to assist users.  
Thank you for being part of the Power BI community and for your continued feedback as we evolve the platform to better meet your needs.

main_title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
content:
# Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators  
![Headshot of article author Jacinda Eng](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a3c2908b415eaa15df72e236d3732e1bc09dad04ed32216be500c30258a06d96?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Jacinda Eng](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/jacindaeng/ "Posts by Jacinda Eng")**
Product Manager  
November 24, 2025  
Introducing enhancements to the **image visual**, bringing it closer to the level of interactivity and design flexibility you’ve come to expect with visuals. This update empowers report creators to craft more engaging experiences for report consumers. Report creators can easily maintain image visuals with more image formatting options, more image source options, the ability to change the image in-place.

main_title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
title: **State-based customization**
content:
## **State-based customization**  
The **image visual** now supports state-based formatting, allowing you to define distinct styles for:  
* **All:** Styling across all states.
* **Default**: Styling when the image is displayed.
* **Hover**: Styling when a user hovers over the image.
* **Pressed**: Styling when the image is clicked or tapped.  
![GIF showing the application of different backgrounds for different states on an ice cream](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31653-1.gif)  
Create dynamic visual feedback for images, perfect for navigation elements, branded visuals, and interactive storytelling.

main_title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
title: **Rich styling controls**
content:
## **Rich styling controls**  
Alongside state customization, we’ve added more formatting options to give you finer control over the look and feel of your image visuals:  
* **Background**: Add colors to enhance contrast or match your report theme.
* **Border**: Customize border color, thickness, and radius around your image.
* **Shape**: Customize the roundness of corners for your image visual to align with other visuals.

main_title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
title: **Image sources and effects**
content:
## **Image sources and effects**  
We’ve also expanded the sources, fit and effects section, giving you control over:  
* **Source of the image**: Add an image through an internet URL or data column in addition to uploading from your device.
* **Image fit**: Select Fit, Fill, Center, or Stretch to set how your image is displayed within the visual.
* **Exposure, Contrast, Saturation, Blur**: Fine-tune the image’s visual look directly within Power BI.  
You no longer need to delete the visual to update its image. With the latest update, you can easily change the image source or swap out the image itself, making edits faster and more flexible.

main_title: Image Visual Enhancements for Report Creators
title: **Let’s try it out**
content:
## **Let’s try it out**  
Here’s some easy-to-follow steps to get started:  
1. Add an **Image** visual to your report from the **Insert** ribbon or **Visualizations** pane.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Image-Blog-Post-Pic-1-scaled.png)  
2. Upload an image from your device to the visual using the **Image** control in **Format** pane > **Image** > **Style** section.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Image-Blog-Post-Pic-2-scaled.png)  
3. Use the **Apply settings to** dropdown to target a specific **State** (All, Default, Hover or Pressed).  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Image-Blog-Post-Pic-3-1-scaled.png)  
4. Customize each **State** with your preferred background, border, shape, and effects.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Image-Blog-Post-Pic-4-scaled.png)  
Continue to adjust the image to meet your reporting needs.  
We hope these updates to the Image visual inspire you to get creative with your report designs. Whether adding branding, building intuitive navigation, or simply making yourreportsmore engaging, the new features give you the flexibility to do it all.  
To learn more about the **image** visual, refer to the [Create an Image Visual in Power BI](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-image-visual) documentation.

main_title: TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)
title: TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)
content:
# TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)  
![Headshot of article author Grace Gong](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1c99b7f2bc3f88ece024dd2293b92bc62c0a83bc4716c45373a39fd0af067f67?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Grace Gong](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/gracegong/ "Posts by Grace Gong")**  
November 20, 2025  
This update brings DAX semantic highlighting support within TMDL documentsalongsideother enhanced authoring features like Power Query semantic highlighting, breadcrumb navigation, code actions, code formatting, localization, andnumerousbug fixes. You can find more details about this latest release in the [changelog](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/analysis-services.TMDL/changelog).  
The Tabular Model Definition Language (TMDL) extension is essential for anyone working with TMDL documents in [Power BI Projects (PBIP)](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/projects/projects-overview). It brings modern code experiences to semantic modeling, enabling scalable development of semantic models with the efficiency, flexibility, and AI-powered workflows that today’s data teams expect.

main_title: TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)
title: Get started
content:
## Get started  
Get the [TMDL Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=analysis-services.TMDL) from the Visual Studio Marketplace to enhance your semantic modeling-as-code experience and accelerate your semantic model development today!  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Picture3.jpg)  
Screenshot of Visual Studio Code Marketplace

main_title: TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)
title: Feature highlights
content:
## Feature highlights  
**DAX support**: Improved readability of DAX code within TMDL documents including semantic highlighting, real-time diagnostics, and autocomplete.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image.png)  
Real-time detection of syntax errors and auto complete:  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-1.png)  
**Power Query support**: Autocomplete, diagnostics, syntax highlighting, hover and formatting.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/09/image.jpg)  
**Localization**: Hover descriptions and code action messages are now displayed in the user’s preferred language, aligning with Visual Studio Code language settings for a consistent authoring experience.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-2.png)  
**Code actions**: Quick fix and refactoring TMDL code such as duplicated lineage tag or misspelled property.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-3.png)
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-4.png)  
**Code navigation**: Easily navigate TMDL document objects in a hierarchical view.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-7-1024x628.png)  
**Code format**: Automatically organize TMDL code for enhanced readability and consistency.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-6-1024x500.png)

main_title: TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension (Generally Available)
title: Feedback
content:
## Feedback  
We value your input and encourage you to share your [feedback – vscode-tmdl GitHub repository](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-tmdl/issues).

main_title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
content:
# New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)  
![Headshot of article author Jacinda Eng](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/a3c2908b415eaa15df72e236d3732e1bc09dad04ed32216be500c30258a06d96?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Jacinda Eng](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/jacindaeng/ "Posts by Jacinda Eng")**
Product Manager  
November 20, 2025  
The new **Card visual** brings a modern and visually engaging way to highlight key metrics in your reports, now with support for hero images, new default styling, and consistent formatting experience.

main_title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
title: **Spotlight your metrics with a hero image**
content:
## **Spotlight your metrics with a hero image**  
Support for hero **images** has been added, allowing you to add an attention-grabbing image to your card, helping your most important metrics stand out and connect with your audience. Whether you’re highlighting a product, showcasing a team, or featuring a brand logo, the new hero image feature empowers you to create visually rich reports going far beyond simple data points.  
An image can be added to the card in three ways:  
1. **Upload image** from your local device
.
2. Pasting in an **Image URL**.
3. **Select from data** to use an image from a data column.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-102223-1.png)

main_title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
title: **New defaults (opt-in for existing reports)**
content:
## **New defaults (opt-in for existing reports)**  
The defaults for the **Card visual** have been updated to deliver a cleaner, modern layout with improved spacing and typography, making your visuals easier to read and more professional by default.  
![Side-by-side comparison of the old default versus the new default of the card visual.](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-11.png)  
All new reports automatically have the new default styling. Existing reports can opt-in by going to the **View** ribbon, expanding the **Theme** section dropdown, then selecting **Customize current theme**. In the **Customize theme** dialog is a button to update to the new default theme which will give you the new styling of the new Card visual.

main_title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
title: **Additional layout and ordering options**
content:
## **Additional layout and ordering options**  
The **Card visual** introduces a dynamic *collage* layout, letting you highlight one section while the other two share the remaining space. You can also customize the display order of the **Callout area**, **Reference label**, and hero **Image**. This flexibility lets you spotlight your most important insights and tailor the card’s appearance to best fit your data story and audience.  
![Image of the new card visual in a collage layout with the format pane open to the Layout group within Cards](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-101637.png)  
The **Card visual** uses the same controls and format pane structure as other modern visuals like the **Button slicer**. This makes it easy to adjust layouts and styles and quickly find settings.  
The legacy card visual will continue to work on all existing reports. The **Visualization pane** will have the legacy card visual hidden. You can add it back by selecting the **Build visual** context menu and choosing **Restore default visuals**.

main_title: New Card visual in reports (Generally Available)
title: **Improvements made**
content:
## **Improvements made**  
As part of our GA release, we’ve made several updates to enhance layout consistency, visual alignment, and overall user experience. Building on the changes highlighted in our [Preparing of the new Card visual in General Availability](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/prepare-for-new-card-visual/) blog post, these are additional enhancements we’ve delivered:  
* **Callout image alignment:** Previously, the callout image aligned to the callout label but now the image aligns correctly within the callout area.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-103223.png)  
* **Background image behavior:** Before, the background image would repeat if they did not fill the container. We’ve updated the image fit and names to align with design principles to prevent images from repeating.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-103451.png)  
* **Reference label padding:** Outer padding in reference labels unintentionally affected the callout area, pushing elements out of place. We’ve removed the **Outer padding** control and added a **Padding** control to ensure there’s consistent spacing across sections.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-105049.png)  
* **Autogrid enhancement**: In certain layouts, an empty column would previously appear. With the addition of Autogrid, it intelligently arranges categories and cards without leaving empty columns for improved usability.  
![Side by side comparison showing the that in certain layouts, the empty space in a multi-category layout no longer appears ](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-13-110317-scaled.png)  
Try adding the new **Card visual** to your next report and experience the difference for yourself.  
For more details and step-by-step instructions, check out the official documentation: [Create a (new) card visual in Power BI](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-new-card)

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
content:
# Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)  
![Headshot of article author Michal Foster Heldy](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1d37724a538b60c07de884b6a6c6d89740a40530667bca8ed9d632fc23d5af8a?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Michal Foster Heldy](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/michalfo/ "Posts by Michal Foster Heldy")**  
November 19, 2025  
We’re excited to announce the release of the **Standalone Copilot** **experience in Power BI Mobile apps!**  
Copilot in Power BI on mobile is a new way to get insights from your Power BI data. You no longer have to search for content, open it, and scan your report. All you need to do is tell Copilot what you are looking for, and it will take it from there.  
Copilot makes it easy to find the answers you need, right from your mobile homepage, providing summaries, key insights, and visualized answers to help you make informed, data-driven decisions wherever you are. Whether you’re looking for a quick overview of your business metrics or want to dive deeper into specific trends, Copilot has you covered.  
The new experience brings the capabilities of the [Power BI Service Standalone Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-chat-with-data-standalone) to mobile apps, delivering an optimized experience for smaller screens. Just like in the service, you can find and ask questions about any reports, semantic models, apps, and data agents you have access to. Copilot finds the right content to provide you with an answer while respecting all existing permissions.  
* **This experience will be available in apps stores in the coming weeks.**  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31602-1.gif)  
Using the mobile standalone Copilot experience to find a report and answer a data question

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Getting started
content:
## Getting started  
Just like in Power BI Service, to use Standalone Copilot, your activity must be linked to a capacity, Fabric Copilot capacity or a workspace with Fabric capacity. If the [requirements for the standalone Copilot](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-introduction#requirements-for-the-standalone-copilot) are met, a new Copilot button will be added to your mobile home screen. Tap to start a new chat. You can type your question or, if you are using iOS, dictate it.  
To help you get started and get faster insights, you can use a pre-defined prompt. Tap on one that best fits your question, then type in the relevant topic. Copilot will analyze your request and deliver instant data insights, summaries, and answers.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31602-2.png)

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Discover more
content:
## Discover more  
Copilot chat offers a rich and interactive way to explore your data that goes beyond simple questions and answers.  
When you ask about a metric or a KPI, Copilot will often generate a visualization in addition to answering your question with text. Just tap the chart to open a pane where you can interact with it and explore its details.  
If you ask Copilot to summarize a report, the response will include a summary with relevant citations. You can tap on a citation to open the related visual in a pane so you can see which report and visuals Copilot used to generate the summary. From this pane, you can also open the visual in the report for deeper analysis and better context.  
Keep your conversation going with Copilot by asking follow-up questions, refining your queries, and diving deeper into insights by chatting with your data.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31602-3.png)  
Copilot on iPhone and iPad also supports dictation, so it’s simple to chat with your data using voice. Tap the mic icon in the chat box, start speaking, and Copilot will do the rest.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31602-4.gif)  
Using dictation in the mobile standalone Copilot experience

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Share Copilot insights with your team
content:
## Share Copilot insights with your team  
If you want to share an insight discovered in the chat with others, just use the Share button from the visual pane to share the visual screenshot, or use the Copy button in the chat to copy the response to your clipboard for easy sharing.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/word-image-31602-5.png)

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Prep data for AI
content:
## Prep data for AI  
Great answers start with great data. The clearer and more structured your data is, the better Copilot can help. Semantic model authors have [tooling features to help prepare data for AI](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/copilot-prepare-data-ai).  
Answers from models that haven’t been prepped will be clearly marked. You’ll see a message indicating the results should be carefully checked for accuracy, along with a button that you need to select to view the answer. This ensures you’re aware of potential limitations before proceeding. Once you select View answer, the response will appear inline.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/View-answer-1024x576.jpg)

main_title: Standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps: Chat with your data anytime anywhere (Preview)
title: Let us know what you think
content:
## Let us know what you think  
With the new standalone Copilot experience, you can easily get quick data answers, discover business insights and chat with your data directly from your mobile.
Stay tuned as we enhance the experience with more capabilities in the coming releases.
We invite you to try it out and share your thoughts. Your feedback will help shape the future of Copilot in Power BI Mobile.

main_title: Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI
title: Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI
content:
# Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI  
![Headshot of article author Mohammad Ali](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/e241d745b76c6f544665d0655d3fdffbe56991c01b80002b76185a54096ab8b0?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Mohammad Ali](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/mohaali/ "Posts by Mohammad Ali")**
Partner Director  
November 18, 2025  
Ten years ago, Power BI entered the market and transformed how businesses interact with data. Before self-service BI, business users waited days, sometimes weeks, for IT teams to build reports and answer data questions. With the introduction of Power BI – any user could download the app for free, connect to their data, and get answers instantly.  
This year, as we celebrate 10 years of innovation, we’re grateful to be recognized as a market leader in the AI/BI space with over 35 million monthly active users across 550,000 organizations.

main_title: Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI
title: BI’s evolution in the GenAI Era
content:
## BI’s evolution in the GenAI Era  
Since the rise of generative AI, the landscape of business intelligence has fundamentally shifted. Today’s business users expect to interact with their data by asking questions in natural language and receiving instant answers.  
Yet, while the promise of AI-powered BI is clear, many organizations struggle to move from experimentation to real adoption. Concerns around data accuracy, governance, and trust hold BI teams back from deploying large language models (LLM) solutions at scale, making it challenging to realize the full potential of next-gen analytics.  
At Ignite, we are launching several new capabilities to tackle these challenges. Our latest innovations focus on two key areas:  
* **For consumers:** We’re making Copilot more accessible across devices, and contextually intelligent by understanding user’s business context.
* **For creators:** we’re opening the platform so technical teams can build custom AI solutions that accelerate analytics workflows without compromising security.

main_title: Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI
title: Context aware intelligence at your fingertips
content:
## Context aware intelligence at your fingertips  
Earlier this year, we announced a new standalone Copilot experience that allowed you to simply chat with your data across reports, semantic models, apps, and data agents that you have access to.  
Today we’re excited to announce that we’re extending the standalone Copilot experience to mobile, in preview, allowing you to ask questions about your data and receive visual and textual insights on your mobile device.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-13.png)  
The search experience in standalone Copilot is receiving a major update – and will make finding insights faster and more intuitive. Copilot can now automatically select the most relevant data sources, asks clarifying questions when additional context is needed, and provides simpler, text-based search results. With new homepage entry points and suggested prompts, you can start exploring insights more easily than ever. This new experience dramatically reduces time-to-insight by removing manual data source selection and guesswork helping every user get accurate answers faster.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-19.png)  
We’re also continuing to invest in our data answering capabilities and improving how users get answers from their data. We’ve made substantial improvements under the hood to how we match user prompts in Copilot to verified answers and the appropriate filters. Verified answers can now interpret and apply filters more accurately, reducing mismatches between what users ask and what’s displayed, better aligning with each user’s prompt. We’re also extending these powerful answering tools to end users through Model Context Protocol (MCP), making it easier than ever to get precise, relevant insights.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-18-829x1024.png)

main_title: Bringing Context Aware Intelligence to Power BI
title: Agent‑Ready Semantic Modeling
content:
## Agent‑Ready Semantic Modeling  
We’ve heard from you – you want faster answers, less manual querying, and the freedom to build custom AI-driven analytics experiences that fit your organizational needs without compromising on security or control.  
Over the next few weeks, we’re rolling out the remote Power BI Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server in Public Preview, that can enable AI agents to securely and remotely chat with your data in Power BI, all while being authenticated with Microsoft Entra ID. With tools to retrieve model schema, generate optimized DAX queries using Copilot, and execute queries instantly. Teams can build custom agents that deliver faster, more accurate insights without manual intervention. Built for interoperability, the MCP Server allows these agents to integrate seamlessly and securely across your analytics landscape.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-20-1024x576.png)  
We’re also making data modeling simpler, smarter and more collaborative with Power BI Modeling MCP Server (Preview). Built on the open MCP standard, it enables AI agents to securely connect with Power BI and interact with semantic models through natural language, so you can focus on intent rather than syntax. You can describe what you want to build, from tables and relationships to measures and refactors, and let AI handle the details. With support for bulk operations, best practice evaluation, and DAX validation, teams can accelerate model development, reduce errors, and bring greater consistency and agility to every stage of the modeling process.  
![](https://powerbiblogsfd-ep-aveghkfaexa3e4bx.b02.azurefd.net//wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-17.png)  
As your organization’s data models grow in complexity, maintaining accuracy, consistency, and governance becomes increasingly challenging. With Semantic Model Version History, now generally available, you can track, compare, and restore previous versions of your semantic models to protect against errors and enable safe experimentation while maintaining full auditability for compliance and governance. With TMDL Visual Studio Code Extension, also generally available, you can author models as code in Visual Studio Code accelerates builds while bringing modern code development practices to semantic modeling.  
Ready to transform your business intelligence?  
The future of business intelligence is here. AI-powered, accessible, and built for trust. Whether you’re a business user who needs instant answers or a data professional building the next generation of analytics solutions, Power BI gives you the tools to turn your data into impact.  
Looking ahead, you can expect a continued focus on simplifying how people interact with data, empowering everyone – from business users to data professionals – to get answers quickly and confidently.  
To dive deeper on these announcements, catch our breakout session [‘Empower Business Users with AI driven insights in Microsoft Fabric](https://ignite.microsoft.com/sessions/BRK223?source=sessions) at Microsoft Ignite on Wednesday November 19th at 4:00 PM PT. To learn more about all the other announcements on Microsoft Fabric, check out [Fabric November 2025 Feature Summary | Ignite](https://aka.ms/Fabric-Ignite-Blog-25) We look forward to continuing the conversation and sharing what’s next for Power BI at the [Fabric Community Conference](https://fabriccon.com/program/corenotes) in Atlanta next March.

main_title: Power BI November 2025 Feature Summary
title: Power BI November 2025 Feature Summary
content:
# Power BI November 2025 Feature Summary  
![Headshot of article author Adam Saxton](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/2d4238c5a038eea0e379744300470a41749dbc959c621b065e2ac437359ea5e0?s=62&d=mm&r=g)  
**[Adam Saxton](https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/author/asaxton/ "Posts by Adam Saxton")**
Principal Program Manager  
November 18, 2025  
The November 2025 Power BI feature update brings several important announcements and enhancements across the platform. Key highlights include the deprecation of R and Python visuals in the Embed for your customers solution, significant updates to Copilot and AI capabilities—such as the standalone Copilot in Power BI mobile apps (Preview) and improvements to Verified Answers—and new options for reporting, modeling, and data connectivity.  
Users will also notice advancements in visualizations, with features like automatically expanding matrix columns and a generally available Card visual, as well as expanded support for Spark and Impala connectors and enhancements to image visuals and the OneLake Catalog. This summary provides an overview of these impactful changes to help you leverage the latest innovations in Power BI.
